definition: (archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: You are a dweller in my deathless dreams.
sentences.chinese: 你是我永生夢幻中的居住者。

sentences.english: On day five, the inhabitants of the skies and the waters are created, birds and fish.
sentences.chinese: 在第五天，天空和水流中的居住者被創造，鳥和魚。

sentences.english: There are several villages inhabited by many thousands of farmers and pastoralists.
sentences.chinese: 這裏也有一些居住者數千農民和牧民的村莊。

sentences.english: What makes insects the most successful inhabitants of the earth ?
sentences.chinese: 是什舉使得昆蟲稱爲地球上最成功癿居住者？

sentences.english: You have semi-nomadic shepherds. You have city dwellers.
sentences.chinese: 這裏有半遊牧的牧民，有城市居住者。

sentences.english: An energy-efficient house system in the U.K. can detect if the occupant has fallen ill.
sentences.chinese: 在英聯邦一所節能房屋能探測居住者是否生病。

sentences.english: The Bubble Room has a translucent bottom half that provides bubble dwellers with a modicum of privacy.
sentences.chinese: 泡泡屋有半透明的底部，能爲居住者提供少量隱私。

sentences.english: It is a big problem for the house roof leakage to puzzle building workers and dweller.
sentences.chinese: 屋面滲漏一直是困擾施工者和居住者的一大問題。

sentences.english: Evicting their occupants would anger the middle classes.
sentences.chinese: 驅逐他們的居住者將惹怒中產階級。

definition: configuration of rooms in a residence (e.g. 3BR 2 Bath)
to reside/to dwell/to live in a place/resident in
